meanings.definition: Swollen or distended, as from a fluid; bloated.
meanings.sent1: The tumid balloon slowly deflated after the party.
meanings.sent2: Her face looked tumid after eating too much salty food.
meanings.sent3: The tumid water balloon burst with a loud pop!
meanings.sent4: The tumid clouds threatened a storm on the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The tumid river overflowed its banks during the heavy rain.

meanings.definition: Excessively ornate or complex in style; pompous.
meanings.sent1: The tumid speech was filled with unnecessary grandeur.
meanings.sent2: The tumid decorations overwhelmed the simple room.
meanings.sent3: His tumid storytelling made everyone giggle at its exaggeration.
meanings.sent4: The tumid castle seemed to mock the modest village below.
meanings.sent5: The tumid painting was so elaborate that it confused the viewers.

meanings.definition: Pompously embellished in style or language; bombastic.
meanings.sent1: The tumid writing in the book made it hard to understand.
meanings.sent2: Her tumid outfit drew attention with its excessive frills.
meanings.sent3: The tumid speech was so over-the-top that it became comical.
meanings.sent4: His tumid promises were as empty as a deflated balloon.
meanings.sent5: The tumid performance left the audience bewildered by its extravagance.
